The action sequences are cleverly mixed with electronic and middle eastern style music pieces that beg to be danced to. You have to be made of stone not to love the Diva's performance, which ultimately won me over on the film. There are several sequences that make prodigious use of seamless parallel cuts(also very funny). And if all this wasn't enough, there are the sets. They're like, Blade Runner and the amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat! It's a mix of old and new(cars look quite 20's, and I'm sure you notice a particular modern day fast food franchise), not to mention the costumes, which combine the best of scifi imagination with some kind of mind-altering drug. If you're looking for an intellectual commentary on future society, you're in the wrong place; but, if you just wanna laugh and have fun and give your eyes a stylist SFX treat, then strap yourself in for a ride...

I hate movies about the future. They are always dark, depressing and downright scary. But this thing is just, well, strange. I don't get it, and I don't like it. And I don't know if it's supposed to be a comedy, drama, satire, video game or what. I have no idea of what to make of this mess. Bruce Willis and Luke Perry do good work, and that's why I gave it a 3, otherwise, you can have it. I'm commenting because they are running one chapter of it on the loop at Best Buy, and I wish they would remove it ASAP. Maybe if they kept the story in the past, the archaelogical stuff...that had more human interest. The female lead has an annoying voice.

No, I really was not disappointed.  The Fifth Element has it all:  drama, comedy, romance, a fast-paced plot, and great characters.  Chris Tucker is laugh-out-loud funny as the dim-witted, vain Ruby Rhod.  Gary Oldman is deliciously sinister as Zorg.  And Bruce Willis is sarcastic and gritty as our hero, Korben Dallas.  The film is set in a mind-boggling future with body rebuilding, interstellar travel, and, of course, flying cars.  The plot (to make it short: defeat the bad guy, use the weapon against evil, save the world) is quick and keeps you on the edge of your seat.  If you have the misfortune of being someone who has not seen this film, I would reccommend that you go rent it.

Imaginative, colorful, and entertaining. The plot was weak where the "Evil/Shadow" and the bad guys were concerned, but the movie contained enough new ideas to keep it fun. If you are a fan of the sci-fi genre, there is a lot to like in the film. As a sci-fi buff, I really enjoyed the imaginative scenery (luxury liners in space). It is always interesting to see how writers and directors view life in the future. The pace was fast and the action relatively believable. Bruce Willis' Korbin Dallas character was entertaining, and could anchor a series of similar films. Milla Jovovich was definitely eyecatching, and Chris Tucker was absolutely hilarious as Ruby Rhod. One thing that I enjoy about futuristic sci-fi movies is that the future is going to be anything but boring. Good job Mr. Besson, keep up the good work.

Not everyone's tastes are the same, but I myself very much enjoyed 5th Element. It was a fresh, new, action packed and entertaining story. Bruce Willis (aka The Jackel) is okay in my book, and hasn't let me down yet.

I watched it in the cinema in 1998 and several times on tv after that. And today again (30.01.21) on Estonian national tv channel, what is a quality sign itself in our country.The FE has so many layers in it. Actors do a fantastic job. I think it is one of the best berformances of Willis, Oldman and Jovovich. The movie is packed, every scene is thought through. Color and costume (Gaultier himself) language makes the movie modern, light and positive (instead of heavy and dark as many other sci fi movies). The Diva performance is hypnotizing, and ending with the elements of EDM (1997!), wich really went into main steam 20 years later.I just like the movie. In its simplissity it has very strong charactre and depth. And i still got goose pumps and also some tears. 10p!

reviews.review_title: Die-hard attitude, Star Trek generations grandeur and comedy
reviews.content: This movie is one of the best edited, best acted, facinating, funny, dramatic, excellent special effects, cool storyline, great one liner's type of adventure that my family and I can't get enough of.  It takes me away to a different land where nothing else matters, total escape from the daily drudges of life.  TRUE plain entertianment without (I think) trying to make a point. Sound track is good too-- just music from the movie-- almost in order-- seems somewhat strange, but mixed with the movie, it makes sense. And who is Luke Besson??  Awesome job!! Bravo!!

This movie was stunning. The special effects were great and the story was top notch. On a basic level it was just good winning over evil, but it was great none the less. A stunning performance by Milla Jovovich and Bruce Willis. Luc Besson is one of the great action directors of the 90's. We can only hope that other Sci-Fi movies can be as good.

reviews.review_title: Besides the unfamiliar elements, it's a great movie for die-hard scifi fans.
reviews.content: This movie is one of the greatest scifi movies I've seen.  For first-time watchers, it seems really odd.  After you watch it at least one more time, the movie seems to get better.  It's pretty obvious that great time and care was taken to make sure the movie had little or no continuity errors, and making certain rediculous scenes were extremely realistic.  The storyline could use a little help to make it flow a bit faster.  Overall, the movie is well thought out and seems entertaining and logical, once you get past some distracting oddities. For first-time viewers, my advice would be to watch it without interruptions and listen closely.

Yesterday I saw this movie on DVD and I am still excited about it. Very spectacular and a lot of different acts. And then suddenly the opera aria. I think if people say they dont like the opera, just see the film and you love it. A great movie and I am gonna see it a lot of times. I am sure of that.
Convince me I'm wrong. Exactly how long do you think a movie review should be? Perfect being doesn't have fire conjuring capablity. Just one match or none of this stuff matters. Right?

This was the best movie I have ever seen in my life. The first time I saw it, it was kind of weird, but it had a sort of charm that no other movie has come close to. After I watched it a couple of times it turned out to have a good plot, good actors and actresses(except for the president), and great special effects. I'm giving it a 10 all the way!

reviews.review_title: a futuristic rollercoaster ride through spectacular visuals
reviews.content: Excellent costuming. Visual effects are spectacular with a cast of characters that develop quickly and lead you through a non-stop tour of Luc Besson's vision of the future. Eric Serra's music score is powerful and dynamic which accentuates and reinforces the movie's overall look and feel. Great role for Milla Jovovich who takes on the cartoon character of LeeLoo and brings it to life. The diva/fight scene is a cinema event that is second to none. It alone is worth the price of admission.

I think the film was more than perfect. One of the top actors that has created his own manner in the film sector was involved with fascinating Milla Jovovich..... Of course I'm talking about our fabulous Bruce...Gary Oldman was also performing quite good with his usual evil guy role. Film, actors (Never forget Chris Tucker), scenario... everything was superb.They made a film watchable for at least 3 times for normal spectators.

reviews.review_title: On of the few movies I purchased that I actually watch often!
reviews.content: The more you watch, the more you find.  Truly superb film making and great acting.  Bruce plays an every-day hero who manages to find himself in the right place at the right time over and over--and manages to pull off some superb action sequences.  Milla is great, Chris Tucker is very funny (totally makes the movie), and the rest of the cast is terrific.Rent it and enjoy!

reviews.review_title: An indisputable MASTERPIECE introducing a new era of Filmmaking
reviews.content: An absolutely dazzling motion picture experience, waking the sci-fi genre from the sleeping death. The commitment made to engineer this manifesto of the epic film- genre, highly qualified for the Palme d'Or of the 1997 Cannes Film Festival. Unfortunately, the picture didn't compete at all. With "Le cinqueme element", Luc Besson and Eric Serra reached the peak of their companionship through many years- together with an almost perfect cast and crew. I've seen the film a dozen times, and it still manages to fascinate me. The score, composed by ever-so-fulfilling Eric Serra, is well thought through and enjoyable listening to- even without the motion picture to accompany it. Honors also go to Jean Paul Gaultier for State-of-the-Art costumes and hairdressing. Never seen anything like it!MAY THE FORCE BE WITH YOU, LUC!

reviews.review_title: Futuristic action to the end! Great stuff.
reviews.content: This movie really had it all as far as I was concerned. I don't really think that anyone could manufacture something like this without an aspect of unrealism.... but it has to be said... "What a great film". Humour, action, one-liners and all the rest. Not to be missed (unless a humerous bone was removed at birth!)If you liked the forceful nature of Leon, you'll love Luc Besson's futuristic effort. Excellent.

Someone can think that maybe it's only a tale for a children but I think that actors were very good (especially Mila - she was 'perfect' :)) And I was very happy that 'love' was the 5th element. It's very nice:) I know that it's not real 5th element but idea was very good (especially when You watch the film with a woman :)

reviews.review_title: The Fifth Element seems to be one of those movies that you either love or hate.
reviews.content: The Fifth Element seems to be one of those movies that you either love or hate. And I love it. The story itself is quite interesting, throwing a new spin of sorts on the battle between good and evil. The broad range of characters adds to the interest and story well (with the exception of The President). The visual effects (especially those of the city) and alien designs are stunning and quite creative. Chris Tucker, although annoying at times, provides quite a bit of humor later in the film. I was surprised, however, that it was not the action packed adventure that I had expected. But, I was also not disappointed by the lack of action as the story (for me) kept the film going. Most of the real action takes place in the last bit of the movie. The only real mystery is how Luke Perry managed to get a title credit for 5 minutes of screen time.

Bruce Willis is one of my favorite actors because all the movies he's been in are great.  Some examples are Armeggedon,and the Die Hard movies.  This is definitelly not a movie that would change my mind about that!!!  This is probably his best performance yet (although Armeggedon is a close tye.) with dazzling special effects, superb acting, and a great script this is my favorite movie ever!!!!

i loved the movie, just because it was silly and even really funny at times. i enjoyed the special effects and i thought the characters were great. bruce willis was pretty good, but by far the best character was brian james as general munro. i thought he was hilarious.

reviews.review_title: Fifth Element is my favorite movie of all time.
reviews.content: Not only did this movie have Techno music and Milla Jovovich (wow), but a plot that I found a rare find. Unlike most action/adventure movies these days, the protagonists had the upper hand the _entire time_. Not by much, but still the upper hand. I liked that aspect of this movie alot.

reviews.review_title: . . .will be regarded as a classic, in due time . . .
reviews.content: like blade runner, *the fifth element* will be regarded more kindly in retrospect.of course some of it was difficult to swallow; of course some of it was derivative of other sci-fi / fantasy classics.but this film failed to *follow the leader* of sci-fi future flicks - the precedent established by classics *blade runner* & *the road warrior* of the future as a bleak dark coloured netherworld.overpopulation? sure! pollution and destruction of basic natural resources? of course! but why do it all in black - what's the matter with a few brightly coloured gaultier fashions and *beautiful people* waiting on you at airports & fast-food restaurants?! ;)the splashy, unique visuals & luc besson's imagery counteract any so-called *weak points* of the overly familiar plot and storyline - *star wars* was once chided for the same premise & plot reasons too, you know . . .
The Fifth Element is my favorite movie in the world, & Bruce Willis is my favorite actor. It is not only funny, it had me on the edge of my seat.

reviews.review_title: Without a doubt, this is my Millennium movie
reviews.content: I recently voted this film my "Millennium movie" after much deliberation and this is why.  Never before have I seen such a vibrant, colourful Science Fiction film that I can watch time after time with no less interest.For a start, the costumes and sets are alive with colour - something that is a startling contrast to the usual dark, almost sinister look of most Science Fiction films.  From the outlandish costumes to the well thought out alien creatures the visuals ooze style.The story, although sometimes a little shallow, is in itself a great good versus evil battle without giving you the feeling that you've seen it somewhere before.Bruce Willis carries his usual tough guy, action-man character into the film without once looking out of place - this was the one actor I thought could have ruined the feel of the movie.  Outstanding performances from Gary Oldman and Chris Tucker, along with some superb bit part appearances from the likes of Tricky and Lee Evans are just a few of the many that make up a superb cast.To me, this film will become a timeless classic - certainly one I will be watching way into the next millennium.

This movie was, in short: Brilliant! When people think they are just going to watch action, they are in for a surprise. Everything in this movie is in synch. The movie is complete, nothing is left out, nothing is forgotten. The movie is like a song, like a symphony. The best example is the part where the fight begins in the theatre. The singer is performing and with what she sings, the pictures change. It's so hard to explain, but the combination of the music and the pictures, together with the costumes and the cast, make this film a joyful ride.
This is the best movie I have seen so far.  It has action, romance, sci-fi, and all that other stuff put all into one two hour film.  Luc Besson does an excellent job of directing and writing.

5th Element is one of my favorite movies.  The costumes were great, as are the sets, it's funny when it needs to be, the action was fun, and all the models playing bit parts is quite amusing.  How many other movies have an opera performance?  Aside from snooty movies about operas.  And Milla, *sigh* Milla is always a pleasure to watch.  i've watched it at least 6 times and will prolly watch it once a year until i die.

This movie has become one of my all time favorites.  I'm hypnotized by it. Especially the opera scene.  I have purchased the movie and still take time to watch it when its on the cable channels.  Bruce Willis is at his best.

I fell in love with this movie the first time I saw it!  Beautiful Milla and handsome Bruce set the movie bolting into the future wonderfully! Amazingly written by a high school student - it truly blew me away!  The kooky humor and humorous characters are set well into the plot.  The story-line is wonderful!  The music is great - perfectly written for the film!  This truly is a blast from the future!  This movie has become my favorite movie of all time.  I will probably have to buy a new movie soon because of being worn-out from watching it over and over again!  I give it two big badda boom thumbs up!

I absolutely love this movie! It is one to enjoy over and over again. Luc Besson's look into this futuristic mythology is colorful and exciting. The characters and the story blend with the special effects to create an experience unlike that of any other film.

The Fifth Element is a colorful and sparkling vision of the future. I am a huge fan of Luc Beeson's work, and this is one of his best movies. Great aliens, costumes, ships, music and actors. A roller coaster ride into the future...

reviews.review_title: Just as good the 6th time you watch it.
reviews.content: This movie is probably one of the best Bruce Willis performances ever, he left the rest of the cast standing (although Milla Jovovich's performance as Leeloo was very good).  The costumes were excellent as were the effects.  The only let down, was Gary Oldman's false teeth and the plastic thing he wore on his head....  I have watched this 6 times and it just gets better and better.

reviews.review_title: Just going to sleep is a better choice
reviews.content: The film didn't have a story that made sense but on the other hand it also wasn't funny.First I thought the way women are displayed is just a critique to other films of the 20th century. It is degrading in such a high degree, this piece of video material can just be a parody. But in my experience, parodies are funny which this film is definitely not. Not even in the slightest. All I could see were confusing dialogues, flat characters and performances that do not even deserve the term acting anymore. Moreover, this pile of scene clutter is so inartistic that I really felt intellectually insulted. But the costumes must have been good right? No, all they did was underlining the sexist undertone that nonetheless stood in the center of the film. My recommendation is to just grab a good book instead. Or you know what? Actually any book will suffice.

I'm serious folks. And I'm serious about my sci-fi.Epic saga. Good guys. Bad guys. Special effects. It has all the regular stuff-- all done very well.What elevates the movie is the fact that the director kept Bruce Willis under control. Bruce has shown, like in Pulp Fiction, that he can be a very good actor when he tones it down a bit-- not a lot, but enough so that he is not the center of the movie. BTW, I'm not a Bruce Willis fan.
Also, the sci-fi "alternate world" consistancy is excellently done. Almost none of the features of this alt world are explain how they work or why they came to be, everything makes sense. Nothing seems out of place and no one, not once acts out of character, not once. A supreme achievement for a sci-fi movie.The characters, including the supporting cast are excellent. Each has some quirky thing going and they all pull off their characters so well. Gary Oldman's "mercenary gun seller's" pitch to prospective buyers is hilarious.
All in all, it is great fun. Do not pass on seeing it on the big screen (perhaps at a local campus?) if you ever get the chance, it is one of the few sci-fi movies that is worth the ticket price (if not more) these days.

This is a uniquely exquisite film for so many reasons that I'll just to have to mention them all. The way Luc Besson seemlessly threads elements of science fiction, comedy, drama, action, romance and thriller genres is of great credit to the man. Simultaneously, he sends us a strong message on the value of life and tells us a cracking story.The look of the film is also spot on, with seemless special effects that are visually stunning but blend seemlessly into the backdrop (the car chase is a must see scene from the moment leeloo steps off the ledge) . Casting, too, is excellent as Bruce Willis is one of the most talented and underrated actors in Hollywood and sparks brilliantly with Milla Jovovich and especially Chris Tucker.If you haven't seen this film, get it now. I mean right now.

I can't understand why this movie didn't get better reviews.  I've seen it several time (unusual for me) and really enjoyed each time.  It has great attention to detail, the kind of stuff that you see little subtleties when you see it again that fill out the plot more.The fight scenes great.Bill Oliver

reviews.review_title: A landmark film - return of the space opera
reviews.content: This film must be considered a landmark film in the same vein as Star Wars and other true space operas. My immediate impression of Fifth Element was "Cool! Somebody else remembers 'Heavy Metal'".  Luc Besson deserves much more credit for this film than he has received. Hopefully, Luc's film represents a flowering of the science fiction space opera. A wonderful companion film to Fifth Element would be a big screen treatment of 'Stranger in a Strange Land' - directed, of course, by Luc Besson himself. Wonderful, visionary film to say the least!

In 1997 Luc Besson presented the 5th Element. Its not just any Science Fiction movie. Its the SF movie of the Decade. Costumes designed by Jean-Paul Gaultier and very strange colors make the movie very strange looking. Bruce Willis and Milla Jovovich make the story alive.

reviews.review_title: THIS IS ONE FILM EVERYONE WHO LOOKS FOR THE BEST IN THINGS SHOULD SEE!
reviews.content: The Fifth Element, WOW, the movie really rocks. Milla Jovovich and Bruce make a great set and they both put a lot of hard work into this film, I believe. Its a true piece of science-fiction for sure but its different from every other monster, super natural film. Its really unique and new which makes it memorable to all viewers and most who view it, not film critics, I've noticed really enjoyed it because they don't look for the practical things they look for the different, odd, and unexpected. The Fifth Element is perfect for anyone who likes the word unique.

With an outrageous story line, terrific characterization and a set design straight out of a Moebius comic this is one wild ride. Vastly underappreciated when released, this is a film that should be taken for what it is - tongue-in-cheek, wickedly funny and loud. Director Luc Besson seems to take great delight in twisting (Hollywood) film conventions and that's part of the charm here. Even Bruce Willis seems to have a lot of fun doing Bruce Willis.

reviews.review_title: A pretty watchable film if only for Milla Jovovich
reviews.content: Fifth Element may have the WORST plot for a sci-fi film this side of Soldier, but it is a thrill ride. The effects and the cracking dialog keep your attention. The worst thing in this movie was Bruce Willis but he and his John McClane type bravado was largely kept at bay by the director (thank God!).The surprise was Milla Jovovich who I thought gave a sexy performance as the cute, powerful yet vulnerable 'element'. She is a good actress no matter what the detractors say.Tucker is loud and obnoxious as usual, tolerable in parts. Its just as well that his role is limited!Overall, I watched it through ONLY for the delectable Miss Jovovich.

reviews.review_title: I just don't like this, I love it!
reviews.content: I must differ entirely with the other comment I read posted here... This is one of the few movies I've ever bothered to purchase -- because it's one of the few movies I can watch on a weekly basis, and still get completely wrapped up in... Cheesy? yes.  Predictable? yes.  You could even say it's formulaic... But it's beautiful!  Divinely comic performances by the actors, lines that bear repeating amongst friends in the know, and a beautiful melange of color, music, and special effects.  It's not a serious, sit-down and contemplate the moral message movie...it's an adventure with good guys, bad guys, aliens, and comic-relief-sidekicks... and it even contains the patented "Bruce-Willis-jumping-through-the-air-screaming-aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh" yell... Too much fun!

All that I have to say about this movie, is that it is the BEST movie that i have ever seen on the BIG screen, or on TV. I have watched this movie 10 times in the last week! The special effects, casting is all great. Milla Jovovich (Leeloo) plays an excellent character as the 5th element. Out of the 6,000 that were interviewed to play this part, I am glad that she got chosen :). The special effects are HUGE in this movie. I keep on wonderin', "would it ever be like this in reality?" THIS IS A MUST SEE IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN IT!!! I give it a BIG 10/10. Perfect. Just Perfect. It Mu5t Be Found

This is a great flick.  If you haven't seen it yet, shame on you! Heh.Breakdown as follows...Gary Oldman is a bad guy.  I mean BAD guy.  He has to get something.  If he does, Earth goes byebye.  Bruce Willis, cabbie, and Milla Jovovich, perfect being, have to stop him.  If they don't, see above. There are several aspects to this movie that make it, in my opinion, one of the coolest movies ever screened.  Let's start with the cast.... Bruce.  John Mclaine.  THE man from Die Hard.  'Nuff said. Milla Jovovich.  She actually learned a language invented for this movie. Someone told me she would write notes to Luc Besson in it.  Oh, did I mention she's one of the best looking women on the planet? Gary Oldman.  He had the greatest part of all.  Jean-Baptiste Emanuelle Zorg.  Is that a cool name for a bad guy or what?  He's one of those characters that no one else could play.  Pick your own example. Chris Tucker.  Ruby Rhod, inter-galactic radio host.  This guy's wardrobe is reason enough to see the movie.  Bzzzzzzzt! The soundtrack..... Eric Sera (see "Goldeneye") put the music to this one.  His score is beyond cool and compliments the film exceptionally, punctuating each scene with exactly the right tempo.  Seamless integration. I don't want to elaborate for fear of being a spoiler, but if you haven't seen this movie, you're missing the coolest vision of the future since Blade Runner.  Trust Me.

reviews.review_title: Ravishing sets, gorgeous costumes, beautiful cinematography.
reviews.content: One of my favorite movies of all time. Ravishing sets, gorgeous costumes (Jean Paul Gaultier), beautiful cinematography (Thierry Arbogast), grandiose soundtrack (Eric Serra), and an excellent story. Acting was, umm... more than sufficient.The story has been outlined elsewhere, but a synopsis of it would be "world is gonna' end, gotta' save it, fantastic odds to be overcome...and fall in love".The visuals, story, and pacing in this movie are timeless, just like 1979's "Alien", and 1982's "Blade Runner" (both Ridley Scott) -in that the level of quality in the cinematography and editing allows them to be comparable to the best of movies produced today. It's not just about digital FX, it's about art.There isn't a moment where you feel the urge to fast forward past the "boring parts" as the pacing is quite solid. Each shot is beautifully composed and filmed, as there are no "junk"  or "filler" shots to be found in this film.The score is excellent, Eric Serra is a master of orchestration, on par with Elfman, albeit completely different styles.The story is quite fantastic -maybe even preposterous, I'll give you that, but it is a sci-fi romantic comedy. I don't think it aspires to be more than what it is, with the simple premise of good versus ultimate evil, that can only be defeated by the strength of love.Although, if you are used to American films and could care less about beauty in films, then don't bother watching this. If you have any care for film at all, see this in one of its wide-screen versions -you are literally missing half the film if you watch pan-and-scan (most movies).If you liked this movie at all and haven't yet seen "La Femme Nikita" or "Leon" (the butchered version of this is known as "The Professional" here in the US), then rent them both (wide-screen, please).

This movie was pretty awful.  The robots with the tiny duck heads were pretty amusing, but beyond that, there was little to recommend this. Appalling overacting, a really hackneyed plot, and a very obvious ending. There are some superficial resemblances to the excellent "Blade Runner", but the only real connection is Brion James, who was excellent in the earlier film and terrible here.  The film is more like a Saturday morning cartoon than a comic book.  I got really sick of the endless gunfights in which Bruce Willis hits the mark with every bullet, but the bulldog/pig-headed aliens can't hit anything.  And the motivations are inexplicable.  Why would anyone take a payoff to help someone who is trying to destroy the universe? Where does Zorg think he's going to spend that money?  And when we finally get to the climactic moment, and Bruce Willis says, "I love you", my reaction was, "Why?  You've only spent about three minutes with her over the course of the film, she's only uttered about a half-dozen words that you were able to understand, and the one time you showed affection toward her, she pulled a gun on you."At least I saw this on DVD for free.

I think that the movie was really good and that more people should have seen it. It was worth the time I spent at the theater. I think that it was the bomb that is all I have to say. When I went to see it, it seemed kind of dumb on the beginning but then it got better as it went along.

This is one of those movies that creeps up on you the more you see it. The first viewing we concentrated on the action, but second and third time left us listening to the dialog more and more.  Bruce Willis is at one of his best roles with Gary Oldman as a great co-star.  Milla Jovovich is riveting as an "Alien?".  A sleeper movie that did not get enough profs when it came out.  The DVD version is great, widescreen picture quality is excellent and the 5.1 Dolby Digital is very well done.  I wonder if a DTS version would be a little more open with the effects sounds.  Watch it on the big screen with the lights out ... great.
This was one of the best movies I have ever seen! They must have had some good acting coaches, cameras, and producers on this show.

The fifth element is a classic sci-fi/comedy destined to be a great cult film years from it's 1997 debut.  After the first viewing you may find yourself feeling a that you were entertained but may be slightly confused due to the fast editing.  After two or three screenings you probably will place this film on your favorites list.  The film is nearly flawless.  The direction is extrememly detailed and nearly every frame has meaning and purpose.   Hilarious comedy, excellent special effects, a unique sound track, interesting characters, quality acting, and a fun story make this film a must for your VCR or DVD library.  The details will make you want to see it several times.

I think that this movie is ideal for people with very specific aesthetic values. It isn't a great movie: It has some plot issues, and of course the science parts are totally bogus. But once you get past these problems, this is a movie which just keeps giving a great experience. The sets, lighting and wardrobe are all amazing. The whole movie has the look of one of those high-culture fashion shows. Add in tons of great Bruce-Willis-Style action, and Chris Tucker's hilarious performance, and you have a real winner. While this is not one of the best movies in my collection, it is the most viewed movie. Aside from "The Princess Bride" and "Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back," this is the only movie that I am always excited to see. This is, however, a bit of a departure for Luc Besson, so if your favorite movies are "La Femme Nikita" and "Leon: The Professional," you may go either way on this one.

reviews.review_title: Luc Besson similitude with Léon The Professionnal
reviews.content: The music, when Matilda ask for help to Leon, is the same music from when Leeloo ask for help to Korben Dallas. The scene is pretty much the same too.

Certainly, The Fifth Element is one of the best science-fiction-films, I have ever seen. It´s not only based on spaceship-wars or anything like that, the amazing thing of this film is, that it´s really crazy: The costumes of this film, designed by Jean Gaultier, are excellent and no one of other genre-hits is able to top them. Finally, I want to say, that it´s a firework of mad (positive) ideas, and because of these facts you can excuse some weaknesses of the plot

reviews.review_title: "Spoilers" The Fifth Element, directed by Luc Besson, is a futuristic world where the fate of the world rests in the hands of two priests, a cab driver, and a divine being.
reviews.content: The Fifth Element, directed by Luc Besson, is a futuristic world where the fate of the world rests in the hands of two priests, a cab driver, and a divine being. Cab driver Korben Dallas (Bruce Willis) unexpectedly find himself in the middle of a race to find the only weapon that can save them-the five elements of earth, wind, fire, water, and the 5th element the divine being Leeloo (Milla Jovovich). The film starts in a sanctuary in the early 1900's in Egypt. An Earth-friendly group called the Mondoshawan land outside the sanctuary to retrieve the stones in order to keep them safe from the evil that returns every 5,000 years. The movie skips to present time when the Mondoshawan spaceship is returning the Fifth Elements to Earth during the crisis of the shadow planet advancing to destroy Earth but is destroyed by the Mangalores who are working for the ruthless Zorg (Gary Oldman). All hope was thought to be lost but a group of scientists discover traces of the Fifth Element's DNA and are able to rebuild it in a regeneration chamber. What they weren't expecting was that the Fifth Element would be the perfect specimen of a woman, Leeloo. Leeloo then escapes the lab and jumps to what you believe is her death until she falls through the roof of a cab driven by Korben Dallas. Korben Dallas helps Leeloo evade the police through a flying car police chase ending at his New York apartment. That is where their adventure begins as Leeloo has informed Korben she must find Father Vito Cornelius (Ian Holm) to save the Earth. Korben is then shocked to find that he has won the Gemini Croquette Contest that he did not enter. General Munro of the Federated Army shows up at Korben's apartment to inform him that he has been reenlisted into the Army and the contest was rigged to ensure Korben is sent to Fhloston Paradise to retrieve the four element stones from their contact, Diva Plavalaguna (Maiween Le Besco). Father Cornelius hits Korben on the head, taking Leeloo and the contest tickets in hopes of taking his place at Fhloston Paradise. Korben finds Leeloo and Father Cornelius, taking back the tickets and departing for Fhloston Paradise. Thus begins their mission to save the Earth.

this is what i wrote for my tv guide:THE FITH ELEMENT, jean-luc bessons visual masterpiece, bruce willis is cool, gary oldman is a little eccentric, ian holm is stoic, milla jovavich is crazy-sexy, tricky pops up, lee evans is funny and chris tucker is flamin brilliant, apart from all these great performances (a 		 lot of good british supporting actors too) the film 		 itself has a good story, amazing special effects it all adds up to a stunningly good film that never loses its breakneck pace and leaves me feeling all moist

reviews.review_title: The Fifth Element was a very good movie!
reviews.content: I watched The Fifth Element over and over again. I thought it is a very good movie. I must say, though, it was intense. But not intensely enough. But yet, very good. Bruce does a wonderful job at acting! Hope he doesn't give up! So keep up the good and wonderful work! I not only like his acting job, but I also like his producing job. I don't have much more to say, except, Keep up the good work! My name is Ashley, by the way. I'm 16 years old and I am in the 11th grade. I also go to Herbert Hoover High School and starting to Carver. Well, I just added that to get my 10 lines in and I succeeded! Keep up the great work!Yours truly,Ashley

In the wonderfully sci-fi movie "The Fifth Element", Leeloo (Milla Jovovich), an alien, faces the challenge of saving the human race. She has been reconstructed from an arm of an alien's destroyed body. The alien was traveling to save Earth from enclosing danger, when it was fired upon and killed. Leeloo is the fifth element, the "ultimate weapon against evil", the only hope Earth has. On her journey, Leeloo encounters many different people. Korben Dallas (Bruce Willis) becomes entangled with the mission when Leeloo literally falls into his cab. He is portrayed as a hero along with Leeloo. They need to retrieve the "stones" before the antagonist of the story, Jean-Baptiste Emanuel Zorg (Gary Oldman), gets his greasy hands on them and destroys all mankind. Leeloo goes through a very personal challenge near the end of the movie. After being shot at and attacked she realises humans have a nasty side that she doesn't understand. She looks up "war" on the internet and is horrified by the images that come up. She has been sent to Earth to protect this race that partial to destruction. She doubts her mission until Korben explains love to her and that no matter how little of it there is, love is worth protecting.I love this movie and the challenges Leeloo faces. It is humorous in it's delivery of an important message and I think it's extremely effective.

This is easily the best science fiction movie ever made. It mixes futuristic thematics with some kind of religion, action, funny scenes and of course it also features a true love-story. Old times, new times. This is one of Bruce Willis' best performances. The look in his eyes, the smile and the laughter. All this put together with one of Luc Besson's best directed movies, make for a real science-fiction masterpiece. Beautifully made. The music is great too. It sets a certain atmosphere. A good atmosphere... After all that is said there could still be said lots of things. i just wouldn't know at the moment. This is an inspiration to other movies following it. It sets new standards, and it sets 'em real high!

There is very little that I would change about this movie. It is nearly perfect. The soundtrack is dead on. The cast is incredible. Bruce is right at home in this role. Chris Tucker's funniest movie, easily. Mila is beautiful and very convincing. Gary Oldman is a great bad guy. The writing is very entertaining, the dialogue is minimal without being too pithy. Very little cheese in this one. The special effects are visually stunning without being distracting. I saw this in the theater three days after it came out with my wife and a friend and there were only two other people in the theater. I mention it to people all the time who have never even heard of it. If you haven't seen it, don't bother renting it - just save yourself the $3 and go buy it. You'll want to watch it over and over. And turn up the surround sound, trust me.

This movie has it all. Everything from a box office draw in Bruce Willis and Gary Oldman. Set and costume design is reminiscent of A list movies like Forbidden Planet as well as Saturday matinee B movies like "Plan 9 from Outer Space.
But what sets 5th Element apart from the others is Mila Jojovich's out of this worlds body that is strategically covered in a uniform fit for a Supreme Being such as her. And her improvisation of her characters language was spot on.

Our favourite movie. Everybody loves it, adults and kids aged 5-10, and we don't tire of watching it.  Friends love it too.  Its got a bit of everything - action, humour for kids and adults.  Not sure why it doesn't rate higher.  Great video and audio, the Diva scene is a classic for demoing home theatre systems.

reviews.review_title: The Fifth Element: A Cult Classic!
reviews.content: This is one of my favorite cult classics! I have seen it millions of times and enjoy it ever time. It is marvelously silly and fun, everyone with a sense of humor should be required to watch this amazing movie! The characters are all unique and perfectly charming in this quirky film, and the effects and filming is well done, an action packed ride that never gets old!....... . ...... ......... ....... ..... ........... ........... .......... ............ ............. ............ .......... .......... ........... ....... ............................ ............ ................ ......... ............ ............ .......... .......

I'm not saying this is a ten but I think it was a great movie that no one bothered with so I give it a ten to bring it up. The attention to sci-fi detail is ABSOLUTELY OUTSTANDING and Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Milla Jovovich, and Chris Tucker were also terrific. It is an ACTION drama/comedy and some people have a hard time with that because they expect Star Wars. It isn't Star Wars. It's Shawn of the Dead meets Sci Fi, funny but serious and poignant. An attention to detail really sets a good sci-fi apart from the bad and if you watch this you will know the difference. Combine this with the Die Hard Comedy of Bruce Willis and you have a must watch movie if not one to own.

While not the most advanced sci-film, nor the most action-packed thrillride, nor the gut-busting comedy, this film provides the best entertainment value I've come across.  The direction and editing are not soon to be outclassed, and I can't recall any movie to day which gives me more enjoyment with each viewing as this.

reviews.review_title: Decent story and great world building
reviews.content: The world that this movie creates is so original and almost breathtaking that I would say this alone would be a great reason to give it a watch at least once.

Watched this again for the first time since it came out & boy, it's a mess!Great visuals. And Jovovich & Oldman are great.But the soundtrack is terrible & distracting, the slapstick is sub-Gilliam, the fight scenes clunky & unimaginative, Ruby Rhod is funny for about 30 secs then just excruciating, the climax is meh.Not at all how I remembered it.

I have seen this movie about 50 times and so has my friend. It only gets better each time. Whats better then a crazy ex-marine that can use a 10 page list of ships and weapons proficiently. Not to mention Mila Jovovich is INSANELY hot. What more to ask for. Violent explosions saving the world and some real HIGH QUALITY humor.

Greetings All,Excuse me for being naive or simple...but, here's my "read" of this film. I think Besson was trying to say that there are in fact 5 elements: Earth, Wind, Fire, Water, and Leela=YouThe "Fifth Element" is humanity (both literal and figurative). So, the only way to save humanity in the literal sense is by using humanity in the figurative sense.Thanks, and remember as Bobby D. said in "Brazil": "We're all in this together."Sincerely, Brendan Ian Burke

I logged on to IMDB tonight because I happened to catch 20 minutes or so of an Uma Thurman film that turned out to be "Even Cowgirls Get the Blues." What I saw of it was so horrible that I was not surprised to see an almost unanimous line of unfavorable comments. Had I seen all of the movie, I would probably have re-thought my list of Top 5 Worst Ever.Since that list was formed in my head before IMDB came along, I've never checked out what other folks thought about the films I would place there, so I immediately thought, "Let's see what people have to say about 'Fifth Element.'" Imagine my surprise to find very favorable - no, I'd say "glowing" - comments about this dogpile of a movie. I respect anyone's right to an opinion, especially about a creative field like movie-making, but I just have to suggest that either I or they were smoking some serious crack while watching it, because there is no way we're talking about the same two hours of our lives.Oh, wait, they are talking about that shrill, unfunny Ruby Rod character (compares to Jar Jar Binks in extreme annoyance, now that I think about it), so I guess we saw the same movie. Now, I like odd, off-key movies as much as the next "World According to Garp" or "How to Get Ahead in Advertising" fan, but I honestly have to say that "Fifth Element" ranks up there on the Worst Ever list with "Orlando," "Spaceballs" and "Full Metal Jacket." (Yes, I am a Kubrick fan, so describing his too-little/too-late "wasn't Vietnam a bad thing?" brutality festival a Worst Ever film is painful.)In short, sometimes Weird is Good, but sometimes Weird just plain Stinks.

Be patient during the opening sequences - the movie starts slowly and my kids were not slow to start moaning about the lack of pace. But once the story began to unfold (and it's not clear for a while what the story is) they were hooked.There are plenty of surprises in the movie. The plot is not very complicated, but odd characters keep popping up to bring variety.The special effects are starting to look dated, but that's not surprising given the age of the movie.Sit back and enjoy. Take it too seriously and you will be disappointed. Accept the quirks as part of its charm.

reviews.review_title: simple plot, wonderderful music, effects and filming
reviews.content:
Fundamentally it's an action movie, but it's got such great music and effects that it's easy to forget that the plot is predictable. 
Someone else commented that the performances were wooden, with which I totally disagree.  I thought each character had plenty of funny bits.

The visual effects are truly breathtaking and seamlessly realised.The film portrays a detailed fantasy universe: we are given a good impression of what life is like in a spectacular futuristic city, and a sample of its diverse culture.There are scenes in the film that look like masterpieces by a great sci-fi artist.The humour is of the best kind: clever and unexpected.On the down side:There are some dodgy performances by British actors (but Gary Oldman is utterly mesmerising).If you learn the whole of human history alphabetically, you get to 'Atom bomb', 'Genocide' and 'Holocaust' (for example) long before you get to 'War'.

I saw it, I liked it, (in spite of Chris Tucker) I bought it on DVD! It's got holes in the plot you could drive a truck through but I don't think it was ever really meant to be taken seriously & it falls a long way down in my list of Bruce Willis' turkeys. Watch it, don't take it seriously, turn off the sound when Tucker's around & enjoy!Of course, I could be wrong................

reviews.review_title: Fun film that's breathless in style and creates a sense of awe!
reviews.content: Luc Besson has to be applauded. He has created a fun and interesting story that looks fantastic with breath taking visual design. This is what we need to see more in the movie industry. Too many directors play it safe, and don't push the boundaries. The classics Blade Runner and Alien gave us a darker, dirtier future. So what about the other side of the coin (or Multi-pass)? The '90's brought us too many look-alike movies with horrible plot lines, stupid science and unimpressive set design and costumes (remember Event Horizon!).If you're going to design a sci-fi film, show me something new, fresh and thought provoking. This movie has it in spades! Lots of stuff you've never seen before, like flying taxis during daylight hours, no rain but sunny skies in a future New York built hundreds of feet below street level (the ocean level dropped hundreds of feet, and the city built downward!), costumes look fantastic and sexy ( thanks to Jean Paul Gauthier) and even Milla's spoken language is freaky. And it's Sarah Brightman who sings the operetta!Even if the story isn't earth shattering, the film works well, and the chemistry between the actors is great. It's even refreshing to see Bruce shift acting gears to a more subdued tone. He's a modest hero in this film, which works fine . Overall, this film does what few sci-fi films do today, it gives you a feeling of awe and wonder at the future.

I have always loved this movie from the first time I saw it. I have I watched it probably for at least 10 times now and still would want to watch it again.All the actors were perfect for their roles and played them wonderfully, from the smallest parts to the main, nothing to take away or add.The effects are amazing for a movie that was made in 1997, I think they should have gotten an Oscar for that. I would recommend to watch it to everyone! I have seen more than a thousand movies and this is my favorite.Big Bada Boom!
If you thought Phantom Menace was too well written, Blade Runner was too funny, and the fist season of Doctor Who had too high of production value, this is the movie for you!

Nothing else quite like it. You name it, it has it. This is the "Lets make a deal" of films. I'll give you $200 for a Big Bada Boom! The few deep thinkers commenting on this film may be better served reading War and Peace. If you go to a movie for entertainment, this is the best movie you'll ever see. If they don't clear the theatre after your showing, you will probably stay and watch again. This is a very hard movie to describe. One suggestion, don't blink. I am giving this film a conservative 11 out of 10 points.

This movie is pure eye-candy. Sure, the plot is a little simplistic, but it's so well-executed that you don't really care. The soundtrack and costumes are inventive. This movie doesn't take itself too seriously (unlike the old chestnuts in the Star Wars train) and has snappy dialogue (unlike the clunky dreck that George Lucas doles out).It's great fun seeing Derek Jacoby hop around, Gary Oldman play the sinister but hokey villain, and of course Milla Jovovich and Bruce Willis are easy on the eyes. The Diva is mesmerising. The Ruby Rod character gets too much screentime.

This movie's got the chick, explosions, guns, monsters, and the best action actor of all time. Bruce, Milla, Chris, and Gary all do great... One Of The Best Movies of all time and i highly recommend it to everyone.

reviews.review_title: Possibily the best film of all time
reviews.content: Without a doubt well before its time. Although it was released in 1997, it's special effects were astounding, even today. The cinematography is fantastic, the score well-played, and the acting superb. It is a excellent pretext to the Matrix, even hinting to the famous scene (come here) when the 5th element was fighting the aliens. The action sequences are not the most important parts of the film, in contrast to an unfortunate number of films that are released nowadays. The parallelism in the film is fantastic, with one scene connecting perfectly with the next. Everything works together as it should; there is simply nothing to criticize about it. Bruce Willis is a great protagonist, controlling every scene while not holding the movie back.

reviews.review_title: Fifth Ekement missing a vital element
reviews.content: Usually Luc Besson can be relied upon to confuse,bewilder and frustrate but at least he can be trusted to always entertain and keep the viewer's attention....except for this much-lauded but over-hyped piece of self-indulgence.So disappointing.

The FIFTH ELEMENT is on my top 10 of all time Films. I just love it. It is so original,  nothing comes close to it. Beautiful to watch. Amazing Set design, Costume design,  Amazing Cast. I can't say a bad thing about this movie!

reviews.review_title: This was a really funny movie
reviews.content: I especially liked the music, and the way it was played in conjunction with the script and I particularly loved Plavalaguna's singing...it was choreographed well, and in retrospect, I can honestly say that I thoroughly enjoyed it when I saw it in a motel on HBO back in 1998...I enjoyed it so much that I bought the DVD of it and watch this continuously much to my boyfriends concern. Since I have to put ten lines of comment on this, I would also like to say that I particularly enjoyed the non-gender portrayal of Chris Tucker as Rodd...he was a scream...I am watching it now on TBS with all the commercials and I noticed that they didn't put in the moaning of the princess when Ruby Rodd was playing back her voice on his microphone.  I also didn't know that Luc Besson married Milla Jovovich in December of 1997...is that a coincidence or not? I must repeat how much I enjoyed this flight into fantasy...and Bruce Willis looked like a stud muffin too...

reviews.review_title: I can watch Leeloo & Korben loves in the same area as me
reviews.content: The best film I ever seen. It's so good that I can die for it! It also have the best couple (double sens) of human in a film ever. Militza Jovovich (Leeloo) & Bruce Willis (Korben Dallas) makes the film even better then the best one. For sure - it have it's weak point, but the best with this move it that you love it the first time you see it, even the first second and you love it in the hole movie and for the endless of time. Even the dead loves it. And when I'm dead I can be a soul on earth and watch Leeloo and Korben loves, in the same area (as me as a married couple of course (even before the death take part)).Just not too good drama of all; not too good special effects ever for that time. But the best drama in the world because of Militza Jovovich & Bruce Willis make it's to a film in the soul of death.

reviews.review_title: Make time to watch the ~The Fith Element ~
reviews.content: Hard to grasp it´s been almost 20 years since i first watched this movie, and i still have that VHS safetely stored, although nowadays no VHS player :ZBut fear not SCIFI fellow fans, because just 1 day ago i ordered it again on Blue Ray, just so i can watch at home with my kids :)So with that being said, i now wan´t to say a few words about the movie itself...I got hooked right at the beginning as they start telling the story about this "Fith Element" , although they do not tell to much until we get to see by ourselves what exactly the 5th element is, and even then we don´t really know...But according to me, they tell the story so nicely visually, and the sound is cool aswell + there´s that underlying humouristic tone that keeps popping up here and there, not to much of anything BUT just BAM there it is agan...One funny moment after another nicely put into what otherwise could have been just a sad one, however here i feel the sad but then also i turns into action and humour...THOUGHTS : Go see this movie asap :DWISHES : I would have like to see more being told about the different races.

reviews.review_title: One of the coolest movies ever!
reviews.content: OK, I saw this movie in the theater for the first time when I was 15 and I thought it was the coolest movie ever! And I'm now 22 and I STILL think it's one of the coolest movies ever! For one, the humor underlying almost every scene is hysterical! Secondly, the music, in my opinion, makes the movie AMAZING!!! Thirdly, ALL the actors are just phenomenal! The effects are incredible, and the color and display of the whole film just blows me away every time. Gary Oldman, in particular, is just awesome! And of COURSE Chris Tucker is in a league of his own in this movie. Besides, what man could wear a rose covered full body catsuit and STILL be appealing to women?? All in all, this movie is great.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies... ever
reviews.content: This is one of the best movies I own. The DVD is reference quality for home theater video and sound, and truly entertaining to boot. I never get tired of the movie and love everyone's performances, particularly Gary Oldman as Zorg. I think the special effects were ahead of its peers for the time the movie was produced. I cannot believe the relatively low rating this movie has received. It is unlike any other sci-fi/adventure/comedy movie I have seen to date. I wish they would make a sequel for it. Ah well... it would probably never be as good.Kudos to everyone involved in the creation of this fantastic yarn for a job well done. Sound, musical score, cinematography, acting, costuming, set design, special effects, etc. etc. etc.

reviews.review_title: Haven't seen it in a long time
reviews.content: That's for sure, but if you say that this movie is stupid, I think that you're the one who does't watch real movies, the mainstream nonsense movies. This movie has a good plot, and even though it is a science fiction movie there are references to philosophical points in life. The one emotion that strikes us al: LOVE. OK, so the movie: Bruce Willis is great as ever. Milla is the coolest. Gary Oldman is good, but Chris Tucker is a little bit annoying. But OK, maybe it's because of his voice which is as worse as Fran "The Nanny" Drescher. But still, the movie is great, if you still haven't seen it, watch it. I've ordered the region 2 DVD and I know that I will watch the movie time after time.

reviews.review_title: Just saw it again on TNT
reviews.content: I'm not sure why, but I have loved this film since the first time I saw it. It is perfect in it's weirdness. All of the elements (pardon the play) work beautifully to make this a truly believable story. I would pay to see Bruce Willis read the phone book, in part because of his thorough believability. On the program "D-V-D on TV", one of the hosts said that he is the perfect anti-Rambo and that is so true. He can play a guy who blows the doors off of the "bad guys" and a nerd who is more scared of his "dead" wife than he is of how mediocre he's become, and a psychiatrist who counsels disturbed children and you believe him in each of the roles. From the Gaultier clothes to the fine Shakespearean actors to the force that is Chris Tucker to the wonderful "language" spoken by Leeloo, it's a great thoroughly entertaining funny ride.I loved it.
One of the most classic sci-fi/post-apocalyptic movies. Great in every way.

Mediocre storyline, very good acting, wonderful singing voice. The Fifth Eelement keeps you riveted to the edge of your seat with action packed scenes throughout the movie while bringing a grace and elegance amidst the chaos with a singing voice equal only to Sarah Brighton. Throw in the comedic genius of Chris Tucker and the Fifth Element is everything you could possibly want in a movie. Bruce Willis is his ever charming grumpy old self. He plays that role very well. Did I mention that the Blue Lady can sing with a powerful yet wonderfully melodic voice? OK, so it's part the marvel of high tech movie making, still, what a voice.If you get what you pay for, then you definitely get your money's worth with the Fifth Element.

Possibly the worst movie ever made. Everything about this movie is dumb and cringe from beginning to end. This is not a science fiction movie, this is the Three Stooges on a clown planet after a lobotomy.  
Chris Tucker should be ashamed of himself. C-R-I-N-G-E !
A weird but very memorable with a good cast.
Terrible. The blue lady singing and moving her arms, WTF is that? The stones in the stomach? Stupid.

One of my personal favorite Sci-Fi romps, it has something for everyone! For me, it was my intro to Milla Jovovich. Great action, hilarious when it needs to be. Really good movie. I consider it an all-time fave.
This movie is wild, and fun to watch all the way through.

It's the kind of story that a 14 year old would adore, and if you look at it dispassionately, it's nothing but dumb. It is also interspersed with fun parodies of Leon and Die Hard. The producers seem to think it's serious science fiction with a dash of comedy, but what you see reminds you of Battlefield Earth.
This guys never seen this movie ! >:(

For me, this one just does not work and in some ways, it was career suicide for Bruce Willis. The movie has dated badly, the jokes are not funny and the plot is about as solid as a wall constructed of egg yolks yet the movie does sort of pass the time in a way that a funeral can be viewed as high entertainment. The special effects may have been state of the art for the time but they have been so eclipsed now to render the cities in the sky as pie in the sky and the attempt at gender-bending may have been funny twenty years ago but borders on the offensive now. It was when I got to the part in which the supreme being after surfing the internet and learning the moves performed a Bruce Lee fight sequence I knew it was downhill all the way. Not so much a screwball affair as a plain and simple all-around screwing of poor ideas. Badly directed and pointless ramshackle ideas without meaning. Sorry, not for me.

This movie reminded me a lot of the Total Recall movie from earlier in the 1990s which I didn't enjoy that much, however Bruce Willis's presence on the screen is always very likable and awesome and can always get you into a movie. While Chris Tucker and many other things were a bit over the top, I appreciated a lot of the humor and thought that the story/mythology was clever. The sci fi action was done quite well in many scenes too. Ian Holm, Gary Oldman, Tommy Lister Jr., Lee Evans, and Brion James were all noteworthy cast members as well, as they are in everything. This came out the year I was born and it's hard to believe how far these kinds of movies have come, yet they won't make movies quite like this again and it's a little special because of that.

This is a mix of fantasy and sci-fi, with some comedy elements. The characters are pretty hyperactive, the settings interesting and with some fairly good visual effects for the time the film was made (the late 90s) (it undoubtedly looks a bit dated now but it is over 20 years old, so that's to be expected), this is an enjoyable film, even though it's not perfect. The plot is a little thin perhaps but it's still quite entertaining. It has very much a comic book or graphic novel, type feel to it. The bad guys are typically over the top in terms of their performance but that's not entirely a bad thing. I can't say I fully followed all that was going on but I did find it pretty engrossing, in terms of seeing what was going on with various characters and the surroundings in scenes. Yes, I'd recommend this.

The Fifth Element is a hugely imaginative and enjoyable film, with only Chris Tucker's annoying character and performance and the occasional lack of flow in the plot being its sole drawbacks. I adored the concept and the story even with the lack of flow never failed to intrigue.

The script and satire are fun and slick, the visuals are breathtaking and unusual especially the amazing Big Apple effects with honourable mention to the camp trip to the resort planet Fhoston Paradise and there are plenty of thrills and imagination in the atmosphere to be had.

Besson's direction is excellent, Eric Serra's music is atmospheric and jaunty and the characters are fun. As is the acting, Bruce Willis is charismatic, Milla Jovovich is beautiful and Gary Oldman is the personification of haute-couture corruption. In conclusion, a great sci-fi fantasy. 9/10 Bethany Cox

As the credits rolled at the end of The Fifth Element earlier today (the first time I'd ever seen it incidentally) I had to check Luc Besson's Imdb page. I was pretty sure he'd made many films since The Fifth Element, but my initial reaction was confusion. How had he managed such a back catalogue when whoever wrote The Fifth Element must have surely been sectioned immediately on the films release? 
Of course I should have realised earlier than I did, Besson was a producer on Taken and I've actually seen many of his films since The Fifth Element that I've inexplicably quite liked (Lockout, 2012, Lucy, 2014). Not to mention the fact that Besson was behind Leon (1995), undoubtedly his masterpiece to date.
The more I thought about the film, the more I liked it. It's Blade Runner on so many drugs that the death knell should be imminent, but the final blow never comes. The invention in the film is second to none, the early flying car chase is thrilling and the visuals back up its $93,000,000 budget. I was reminded of several films as well as Blade Runner, Terry Gilliam's Brazil (1985) is a touch point, and Star Wars is absolutely in the fabric of the film. The big difference between this and Star Wars however, is that The Fifth Element doesn't take itself seriously at all, and in that respect you feel fine laughing at it. When Star Wars is silly, you get frustrated at the fact that people take it very, very, very seriously. The presence of Ian Holm also reminds you of Alien (1979), and there's even a nod to Moonraker (1979) at the films conclusion. What also must be mentioned are the performances. Sure, Bruce Willis plays John McClane in what must now be looked back at as The Fifth Die Hard (that's a really good joke if you appreciate the 5th Die Hard film shouldn't exist for crimes against cinema) but Gary Oldman and Chris Tucker almost walk off with the film with outrageously brilliant performances. It's also highly amusing when Bruce Willis tells police he is not a human, he is identifying as a meat popsicle; and as a result avoids arrest. One wonders when The Fifth Element is inevitably released for a 25th anniversary next year, whether that joke is vaporized from existence to avoid inescapable offence. Deranged doesn't even begin to describe The Fifth Element, amongst scenes of cinematic carnage there are breathtaking visuals and wonderful performances. The only way to make your own mind up is to see it.
One of my all time favorites!

Bruce at his BEST (save orig. Die Hard)! This was always one of my favorite movies, but it didn't do that great at the box-office (given the budget and expectations) and got average to poor reviews "initially"??? I'm glad everyone is starting to figure it out "finally", the rating will only continue to go higher.. watch, as of 6-27-21 the rating was at 71% critics and 86% audience (I remember when the critics rating was below 60% and considered rotten). 

Plus you add Oldman's incredible performance as the bad guy (who was every bit Willis' equal), which made it more interesting/fun imo. And Chris Tucker, haha, wow! Then you add the insane brilliance and vision of Luc Besson and ground-breaking CGI for the time, and you'll have to agree it's way better than the rating. It's also one of those few movies I have enjoyed watching MANY times, which is unusual for me.

Luc Besson's science-fiction adventure comedy The Fifth Element (1997) is a truly deranged piece of cinematic history from the now infamous French filmmaker Besson. It starts off with an ultra serious sci-fi set-up only to immediately turn into a buddy comedy with some romantic comedy territory in the midst of this sci-fi adventure. I think Luc Besson directed a real classic with Leon: The Professional, but The Fifth Element is merely a fun movie. The CGI effects are really dated and corny. The dialogue is clunky and filled with pointed sci-fi jargon and exposition to justify nonsense on screen. There's so many cringe moments that don't work, especially with the jarring editing that's so late 90's, it's absurd. Overall, watch The Fifth Element for the Bruce Willis parts and I'm sure most viewers will find Milla endearing as the "perfect" woman Leeloo.

 It's quite funny and action packed due to Bruce Willis' charm as the taxi driver turned universal savior with a crush on the beautiful Milla Jovovich. Willis certainly elevates this picture with a charismatic leading man aura, funny comedic timing, and intense dramatic skill that he uses in bursts here and there. Jovovich is fun and playful with moments of tender vulnerability as Leeloo. I love her delivery of nonsense divine language talk that sounds like Latin, French, and Italian all at once. She's got nice chemistry with Willis. I do find it creepy that Besson left his wife for her, who he dated since she was 12 when he was 29. Besson infantilizes Leeloo with the baby talk and weird outfits too. It's even stranger to think that the blue diva opera singer is played by Luc Besson's wife at the time. The Fifth Element is truly strange.

I have to mention Chris Tucker is just overacting the entire movie. He shows up more than halfway through as this gross parody of a drag queen with an obnoxious scream. He just shouts horrible dialogue and repeats himself with awkward buzzing and incessant yelling. I found maybe 5 lines of his funny with the rest nearly ruining The Fifth Element. In a movie with Gary Oldman chewing the scenery with his awful haircut and over the top Southern accent, Tucker is still more flamboyant and outrageous. This is seriously a strange picture, but many of the dated or annoying elements might be fun upon revisiting for new viewers.

In short, I cannot hate The Fifth Element. It tries so hard to make interesting sci-fi concepts out of nowhere, thrilling action sequences, and pleasant comedic adventures around space. I think Bruce Willis really saves The Fifth Element overall, but Milla Jovovich brings a realistic warmth. The scene where Leeloo watches war footage should be corny, but her tears make it a raw, emotional moment. Bruce Willis really used to try once upon a time.
I liked Bruce Willis in this movie!!! I must say that Fifth Element has a complicated story and can't keep track well!!!

It has great visuals, great sci-fi setting, great music especially the diva scene, great action (Zf-1 is probably the most bad-ass weapon I’ve ever seen). Strongly recommend it.

In a not so distant future the universe is threatened by a malevolent evil force. An unwitting cab driver(Korben Dallas) is thrust smack dab in the middle of a cosmic battle, a war at this point is eons old. It's now a race against time for Korben to search for a find The Fifth Element, the protector of all humans with four powerful elemental stones, Fire, water, earth & air. The remains of this fifth element are used to rebuild an immaculate being, Leelo who's sole mission is to retrieve the stone alongside Korben, who she's recruited to help. It all comes to a head when an all out battle of good vs evil commences and we're left wondering if this is a world worth saving. 

The Fifth Element is a timeless classic and flat out just a great movie, I really can't stress that enough. The special effects are superb, truly groundbreaking filmmaking and its certainly garnished massive cult appeal over the years. With a stellar cast and very unique and inventive sci fi story makes for a spectacular movie.

There are no words to describe the epic and beauty that this film represents. Milestone of the science-fiction genre, "The fifth element" still has not lost its charm, still remaining an excellent and very enjoyable film: in short, another masterpiece made by Luc Besson. Its special effects might feel the weight of the years behind them, however an exceptional cast, a compelling story, a charismatic villain and a pretty good romance mix well together, creating an artwork that everyone should watch and admire at least once in a lifetime. Despite its enormous qualities, it's not perfect: on the other side of the scale we can observe in primis some comic elements that in some scenes fits very well, while in others (especially in the presence of "DJ Ruby Rhod") it tends to exaggerate, making all very uncomfortable and cringe; in secundis the presence of a final scene characterized by banality and mawkishness; I won't dwell on it to avoid spoilers. Concluding this film is excellent, maybe it will not be perfect, but I recommend everyone to take a look.

Final mark 9/10

In contrast, I much preferred the original Total Recall.  That movie had a cool little story, it was futuristic and held up way better.  So in conclusion, I can't stand this movie.  Unless I'm in a situation around a bunch of brain dead people watching this, I will absolutely never watch this again of my own free will. I had heard so many positive reviews of this film from people I respect including my beloved parents and so when I sat down to watch it with my family I was fully prepared to love it. I found that I admired it but I don't think it's on the level of 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968) or Blade Runner (1982), although my mother would disagree on the latter, and I didn't feel passionate about it. The visual style, from the costumes to the special effects, were distinctive and beautiful and the direction was great as most of the film is mesmerizing. I would definitely recommend that people see the film and I would praise it for managing to balance a comedic tone with serious science fiction. The 1990s produced a lot of great films and I don't personally believe this reaches those heights but it's still a hugely enjoyable experience.

Korben Dallas, Bruce Willis, is a taxi driver who has the "Fifth Element" fall into his taxi in the form of Leeloo, Mila Jovovich, who he immediately falls in love with and protects against the police. Priest Vito Cornelius, Ian Holm, has been waiting for the fifth element to appear since 1914, the film is set in 2263, and helps to educate Leeloo when Korben brings her to his door. The major villain is Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg, Gary Oldman, who is under the control of the great evil and faces death if he is not able to attain the stones that will cause the great evil to be destroyed if combined. As the love between Korben and Leeloo continues to grow they have even more incentive to prevent the world from ending due to the great evil.

Jean-Paul Gaultier, legendary French fashion designer, was employed to design the costumes for the characters in this film and it shows as we see Willis in an orange mesh halter top one minute and Jovovich in â~bandages' the next. The whole affair has a French affectation to it that makes it look wonderfully outrageous and sophisticated, it's brightly colored and ostentatious but always classy. Along with this the visual style of the entire film is insane, it has touches of Logan's Run (1976) but is also all it's own. The flying cars, the concert halls and the villain's lairs are all lavishly set up and create a world that feels very constructed and self-conscious but so what? It's a wonderful, psychedelic vision straight out of Besson's head.

The performances were good enough for a film that requires them to do very little but I feel that Oldman was not particularly good as a villain. I had heard so much about how iconic this performance is and how scary but campy he manages to be. I just thought that his Southern accent was poor and he wasn't serious or campy enough to be very entertaining. The better respected British actor playing a villain in a Bruce Willis action movie was Alan Rickman in Die Hard (1988) as he is genuinely chilling but also funny in all of his little idiosyncrasies. Seeing Jovovich be used properly as an action lead was nice despite her being objectified at points and she manages to give the character she plays more personality than I imagine was on the page. Willis is solid and has nice chemistry with Jovovich and it was funny to see Holm in the same year as his brilliant performance in The Sweet Hereafter (1997) which is far more serious in it's tone.

I didn't emotionally engage with the characters in the way I would have liked to, maybe it was the comedic tone and I don't think the film is trying to ask the sort of philosophical questions that Blade Runner is. It was because of this that I found the film to be entertaining but empty and even as I cheered at the sight of Korben and Leeloo engaging in physical contact in the pod at the end of the film I wasn't moved. That should not be a requirement for a film, some films exist purely to entertain and thank goodness but it is because of that that I don't see this as the classic that some people do.
